title: Erin Molan reveals her arm sling after breaking her arm in nasty fall and announces new project
text:
Erin Molan broke her arm and hand during a nasty fall earlier this month.

And the 37-year-old took to Instagram on Tuesday to update her fans on her condition and showed off her arm cast.

The TV star also announced her new project - she is working on a line of baby items with Baby Dream.

'Yes I am still resting!' Erin Molan (right) revealed her sling after breaking her arm in nasty fall and announced she's working on a new project, a line of baby items with Baby Dream. Pictured with his daughter Eliza and Dream co-founder Cris

Alongside a photo in which the new mum sits beside her daughter Eliza and Baby Dream co-founder Cris, she revealed the details of the project.

Erin wrote: 'I've been working on this for nearly 15 months now... so much research, designing, then redesigning, then re-re-redesigning, patenting.

'So many samples, fabrics, cuts, sizes, trials and errors, experiences, lessons and little joys along the way.'

She went on: 'So wonderful to work with this wonder woman Cris was the nurse on duty who helped deliver Eliza - fairly brutal way to meet but we've taken our relationship from home run back to first base'.

Ouch! Erin spent 10 days in hospital after breaking her arm and hand in a horrific accident at home. She has been working on her Baby Dream project from home

She added: 'And if mum sees this... YES I am still resting (for the most part)'.

Erin spent 10 days in hospital after breaking her arm and hand in a horrific accident at home.

The Channel Nine sports reporter tripped and fell as she walked downstairs during the night to fetch a bottle for her daughter Eliza.

The blonde has now returned home to rest and will continue to miss work duties until she's made a full recovery, Nine News reported.

Oh no! The Channel Nine sports reporter tripped and fell as she walked downstairs during the night to fetch a bottle for her daughter Eliza (pictured)

Her absence from Nine and her radio show comes amid claims she had been sidelined by the network due to reported feud with Andrew Johns.

The 45-year-old 'doesn't like working with her', a television source told Daily Mail Australia earlier this month.

The source said Andrew's biggest gripes were that Erin giggled and spoke over him and other Nine personalities when they were talking about football.

Nasty fall: The blonde has now returned home to rest and will continue to miss work duties until she's made a full recovery, Nine News reported

Another source close to Andrew said he did not know when the problems between the pair began but the footballing great would not be backing down.

A Channel Nine spokeswoman said claims Erin was sidelined by the network during the NRL Grand Final were 'clearly another beat up about Erin'.

Victoria Buchan told The Daily Telegraph: 'Erin hosted the first three hours of the (grand final) coverage on the day from the ground and did all the post-show interviews with the families of the winning teams.'
description: Erin Molan broke her arm and hand during a nasty fall earlier this month.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
